parameters.name: Doc
parameters.description: Document whose units you want to use

parameters.name: NewValue
parameters.description: Value for this dimension in the units of the document specified by Doc

parameters.name: WhichConfigurations
parameters.description: Configurations to set the value as defined in swSetValueInConfiguration_e

title: IDimension.ISetUserValueIn3
description: Sets the value of this dimension in the units of the specified document.
signature:
System.Int32 ISetUserValueIn3( 
   ModelDoc2
Doc
,
   System.Double
NewValue
,
   System.Int32
WhichConfigurations
)

parameters.name: Doc
parameters.description: Document whose units you want to use

parameters.name: NewValue
parameters.description: Value for this dimension in the units of the document specified by Doc

parameters.name: WhichConfigurations
parameters.description: Configurations to set the value as defined in swSetValueInConfiguration_e

returns: Success indicator as defined in swSetValueReturnStatus_e
remarks:
The WhichConfigs argument is equivalent to the
Change Parameter
dialog in the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface, which gives the user the option of having the value set in all configurations or the current configuration. If there is one configuration in the part, SOLIDWORKS ignores this argument.
This method allows you to change the value of a read-only dimension. You can use
IDimension::ReadOnly
to determine if a dimension is read-only.
